alert.note: Alert for Cooke; Denton; Grayson; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 24 at 5:23AM CDT until March 24 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Wise County in north central Texas... Denton County in north central Texas... Southern Cooke County in north central Texas... Southwestern Grayson County in north central Texas... * Until 615 AM CDT. * At 522 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Fairview, or near Decatur, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...65 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Plano, Carrollton, Frisco, Denton, Lewisville, Flower Mound, Coppell, The Colony, Southlake, Corinth, Gainesville, Highland Village, Trophy Club, Lake Dallas, Sanger, Decatur, Whitesboro, Briar, Lake Lewisville and Little Elm. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 468 and 497. Interstate 35W between mile markers 68 and 85. Interstate 35E between mile markers 446 and 466. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...65 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
